item.description:
For ages 8+
2-6 players
This is the 2nd version of Pokemon Monopoly.
 Includes:

* 6 collectible Pokemon movers - Chikorita, Totodile, Marill, Cyndaquil, Bellossom, Pikachu
 * 32 Plastic Poke' Centers and 12 Poke' Marts to improve your Pokemon's strength
 * 28 Pokemon Deed cards and 7 denominations of Pokemon-themed play money
 * 16 Ash cards and 16 Professor Elm cards, replacing the traditional Community Chest and Chance cards
 * Special optional Poke' Rules and full-colour Gameboard

Game info:
In this Gold and Silver Pokemon edition of the classic Monopoly game, you'll travel around the board in search of Pokemon from the Johto World. The more Pokemon you collect, the more powerful a trainer you become. Add Poke' Marts and Poke' Centers to make your Pokemon even stronger. Ash cards and Professor Elm cards may bring rewards or other surprises. Bargain, trade and fight with other trainers to collect the most powerful Pokemon team and win the game!

name.value: What Everyone Should Know About TRENDS & LIFESTYLES
Hva alle burde vite om TRENDER & LIVSSTILER
Mitä jokaisen tulisi tietää muoti ja trendit

item.description:
From the publisher:
This game covers the whole scale from haute couture to everyday trends. Do you know which international fashion house uses the initials LV, or which animal appears on the Lamborghini logo? If you don’t, find out with What everyone should know about trends and lifestyles!
On each turn players take one card and try to answer to the question on there! When getting the answer right you get 10 of the money the game uses! Then you have another change to go! Get it right again, you get 20, then 50, then 100 and then you have to give away your turn!
You win the game when collecting amount of money agreed with other players at the beginning of the game! For example you win, when you get 250 that money!

name.value: What Everyone Should Know About TRAVELLING IN EUROPE
Hva alle burde vite om REISING I EUROPA
Mida võiksime teada reisides mööda Euroopat
Mitä jokaisen tulisi tietää matkalla Euroopassa

item.description:
From the publisher:
This game will take you on a trip to Europe. Everyone knows the leaning tower of Pisa, but do you know why it doesn’t stand straight? If you don’t, find out with What everyone should know about traveling in Europe!
On each turn players take one card and try to answer to the question on there! When getting the answer right you get 10 of the money the game uses! Then you have another change to go! Get it right again, you get 20, then 50, then 100 and then you have to give away your turn!
You win the game when collecting amount of money agreed with other players at the beginning of the game! For example you win, when you get 250 that money!

From the publisher:
A unique dictionary game – now you can have fun while learning French! Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words divided in five categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The three difficulty levels make it possible for each player to play on the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills. A game that all family can play together and learn languages at the same time!

name.value: What Everyone Should Know About GREAT INVENTIONS
Hva alle burde vite om STORE OPPFINNELSER
Hva enhver bor vite om Store oppfinnelser
Mida võiksime teada olulistest avastustest ja leiutistest
Mitä jokaisen tulisi tietää suuret keksinnöt

item.description:
From the publisher:
This game makes the cogwheels of your brain turn. Do you know who invented the bicycle, and how Blu-ray differs from DVD? If you don’t, find out with What everyone should know about the greatest inventions!
On each turn players take one card and try to answer to the question on there! When getting the answer right you get 10 of the money the game uses! Then you have another change to go! Get it right again, you get 20, then 50, then 100 and then you have to give away your turn!
You win the game when collecting amount of money agreed with other players at the beginning of the game! For example you win, when you get 250 that money!

name.value: What Everyone Should Know About THE AMAZING EARTH
Hva alle burde vite om DEN FORUNDERLIGE JORDEN
Mida võiksime teada MEIE KODUPLANEEDIST MAA
Mida võiksime teada meie KODUPLANEEDIST MAA
Mitä jokaisen tulisi tietää hämmästyttävä Maailmamme

item.description:
From the publisher:
This game will take you to the hottest deserts and the deepest oceans, and even beyond the Moon! Do you know how many bridges cross the Amazon River, or what causes solar eclipses? If you don’t, find out with What everyone should know about the amazing Earth!
On each turn players take one card and try to answer to the question on there! When getting the answer right you get 10 of the money the game uses! Then you have another change to go! Get it right again, you get 20, then 50, then 100 and then you have to give away your turn!
You win the game when collecting amount of money agreed with other players at the beginning of the game! For example you win, when you get 250 that money!

From the publisher:
The funtastic party game in a handy travel size edition! Party Alias is a hilarious version of the popular word explaining game Alias – a word game with a twist! The words are explained in completely new and crazy ways whenever the team lands on one of the Party spaces. You might get to tell a crazy story that includes all the words on a card, describe celebrities, or try to explain the words without using a certain letter. You also get to explain words in different moods – will you be hysterical, depressed or angry? Party Alias challenges everyone to explain, get active and use their creativity!

This travel version is different from the first Party Alias. It uses dice instead of a spinner, has fewer cards, and the story telling cards are made a little shorter (only 4 required to get the bonus).

From the publisher:
The game includes a total of 600 Norway concerning questions! By responding to the questions you tick off the pyramid in your subject areas. You be the first to check off 5 circles, you are a winner!

From the publisher:
Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language!

The Pacific Ocean, 1835. The ship „HMS Beagle“ arrives at the Galápagos islands. On board is the young biologist Charles Darwin, who is later to become famous throughout the world for his revolutionary ideas of evolution and natural selection. However, before this, he spent much of his time collecting and examining a variety of different species. In this game, the players are biologists walking in the footsteps of Darwin. They go on expeditions on the Galápagos islands in order to discover rare species, and create exhibitions to score exhibition points. The player with the most exhibition points when the game ends wins the game

item.description: The object of this game is to try and enter the "Council Fire" while collecting as many 'Honor Beads' as possible while on the way around the board. The player capturing the most points in Honors wins the game. One unusual part of this game is that players all play at the same time. There are no turns in the game, so no waiting for your turn before you play. The winner is the player who captures the most Honors, not neccesarily the person who finishes the game first. You must get to the "Log Cabin Council Fire" by exact count in order to end the game.

This is a card game. There are 3 classes of cards, cards called Sellers, cards with pictures on them called Spectators and money cards. The Seller cards and the Spectator cards are shuffled to form their own decks. The start player draws a Seller card to see what they have to sell and the selling price for the item and then a Spectator card to see if they draw a person willing to buy whats for sale. If they get that combination of an item and a willing seller the player takes the amount of money shown on the Sellers card out of the 'bank'. Some cards show 'no sale' There are also two 'pretty girl' cards, one will buy and one will sell. There is also a 'constable card' which if drawn, the player drawing the card is immediately arrested and so losses his/her turn. When the seller cards are exhausted the game ends and whoever has the most money wins.

Do you have the right cards to be a good cat? To be a bad cat? Can you trick your friends into giving you the cards you need? Do you think you know your friends well enough to know when they’re bluffing? Will you keep them from getting a point or help them?

At the end of the day were you the kind of cat you wanted to be? Everyone will know if you’ve been a good cat or a bad cat!

Good Cat Bad Cat is a game of strategy, bluffing, and paranoia! What else would you expect from a game about cats?

Good Cat Bad Cat is a fast paced game that is easy to learn!

Note: In addition to the cards, you will need 6 CCG sized card sleeves or something similar to use for the card envelopes. A pencil and paper are also needed to keep scores!

item.description:
Players compete by placing cards to line up three in a row of the shape that matches their secret Goal. The first player to score five Goals wins! But beware... placing a card can help your opponents as easily as it can help you!

Triplica includes two multi-player games and a highly addictive solitaire version. With three ways to play, choose the version that is best for you. Triplica combines a mix of strategy and luck, and is easy to learn and fun to play.

item.description:
Arena is a four-in-a-row game, much like Connect Four or Score Four, with two distinguishing features:

 Players alternately place/stack pieces along a wrap-around circular/cylindrical path instead a grid.
 The board is not divided into discrete spaces; pieces are considered neighbors until a piece is laid between them.

name.value: Junior Alias med Bamse & Kylling, Kaj & Andrea og Anna & Lotte

item.description:
From the publisher:
In this Alias game with all your TV favorites, you must explain the words and images to your team without mentioning the word to be explained. You may use synonyms, clues, etc. The number of correctly guessed words matches the number of fields which the team must move up on the gameboard. First Team to finish wins.

From the publisher:
English phrasebook games with 250 practical words and phrases that you need, when you're traveling. To win the game you must translate words and phrases correctly and deleting categories in your triangle. You can play alone for training your travel English. Convenient format for luggage. A fun way to train travel in English!

From the publisher:
Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language!

From the publisher:
Straight couples game in travel version now. Game is about to find out how well couples know each other. The game can be played by couples against couples or one couple. In order to advance in play the answer sheets must fit together. First couple to reach target wins the game. If a single pair is playing, so the aim is to find out who know their partner best.

From the publisher:
An exciting quiz for Europe - now in handy travel version. The game contains 600 questions, divided into six categories: History, Culture, Technology and Natural Science, Geography, Sports and Mixed. Answer the questions, strike category circles, and become the first player to answer correctly to the last question to win the game.

From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

In Faqir players try to make specific patterns with nails (cones) that match with the pattern on a card they have drawn.
The first player to achieve this wins. Each card is partially visible to the other players; use this to spike the fakirs of your opponents!

Taken from the publisher website:

Everyone knows about the faqirs lying on beds of nails, but the ones in this game are not so keen on sharp things – they prefer to squirm between the nails! Who is the first player to place the nails so that their faqir dares to come out from his dressing room to perform? Faqir is a great game for the whole family – all you need is some perceptive skills, light strategic thinking and a pinch of luck!
The famous Monopoly game. This edition has the theme Dordrecht, a dutch city. Try to get the streets of Dordrecht and build your houses and hotels.
The famous Monopoly game. Try to sell and buy property in the Dutch city Enschede. Collect streets and build houses and hotels.

The players collect jewels from the dragon's cave and place them in their jewels box. The first player to collect 4 of each color (red, blue and yellow) wins. If the dragon catches the player he chases them to the exit.

The game uses a mechanic of common control where each player controls the dragon on their turn.

A simple educational card game for two players. Both players have a deck of 17 cards with different military ranks of Polish Army from 1939. Both players take three cards in their hands and secretly put one of them on table. The player who put a card with higher rank is able to take cards from the table and gain higher military rank. A goal is to become a marshal.

Third revised edition has been expanded to accommodate third player. This new (2017) edition also adds Military Police cards allowing the players to take one card already used back to the hand.

item.description:
From the publisher's website:

Have you ever said "jinx!"?

USAOPOLY turns "jinx -- you owe me a soda" into Sync Up!, the hilarious new party game where players are paired up to try and say the same thing at the same time. With a variety of fun categories, only a few seconds to answer, and a different partner every round, each game’s a toss up of who’s going to Sync Up! the most to win.

To start, one player picks a card, reads the category and the first question followed by "Ready. Set. Sync Up!" (to give partners a quick moment to think.) So for example, the category is "pizza" and the question is a "a meat topping... Ready. Set. Sync Up!" Couples shout out their answers. If they both say "pepperoni" they move ahead 2 spaces on the game board. If one says "pepperoni" and the other says "sausage," they stay where they are on the board. At the end of each round, players switch partners and play a new card. To make the game more interactive and challenging, players can use Make A Bet Cards to score extra points by guessing how many times partners Sync Up! on each turn. First player to reach the Winner Circle wins the game.

item.description:
Fatal Blow is a skirmish game of miniature combat between individual warriors, fighters and knights. Fatal Blow is designed to be a fast playing but intriguing game of battle between fantasy and medieval era warriors. 
To most experienced miniature gamers, there is a lot about Fatal Blow that will be familiar, however whether your are an experienced miniature gamer or not you will find a lot about Fatal Blow to set it apart from other skirmish games in this setting. In Fatal Blow, BOTH the warrior and his weapon(s) will be crucial to his success or failure in any particular combat. In addition, no matter how powerful a character is, or how weak his opponent may be; if armed with the right weapon, the weaker opponent always has a chance of killing his powerful foe with a single, well laid blow.

Toystore Chess begins with an empty 5x5 board and a King, Queen, Rook, Bishop, and Knight in reserve for each player. Opponents alternate placing one piece at a time on any open square until all pieces are on the board. Play proceeds as Chess.

Players will be able to correctly match the 50 states in the USA with their capitals.

Object of play is to form matched pairs of states and their capitals. When a player gets rid of all of his or her cards, that player wins the game.

Scoring: The winning player receives 5 points for each card remaining in the other players' hands, whether they form matched pairs or not. Each player, including the winner, receives 10 points for each correctly matched pair and loses 10 points for each incorrectly matched pair that he or she laid down during the game. A list of states and their capitals should be provided to assist players during scoring.

Components:
100 cards
50 states & 50 capitals

name.value: States in Mind: Regional Rummy & State Line

item.description:
The players(s) shall be able to recognize the various regions within the United States and group states accordingly.

Player in his turn asks any one participant for a card from a particular region. If the participant has a card from that region, that card is given to player. If not, player draws a card from the stock pile. If card drawn from stock pile is of the region requested, player may continue to call on individual participants for a specific region until players or pile do not respond with region requested.
Play continues to left. When player has a complete region, that region is placed in a stack on the table.
Game is won by player with no cards remaining in hand.

Components:
50 cards

Find the greatest number of objects hidden in the game boards. In the “Time Challenge”, children are invited to locate eight objects used to measure time in each of the eras depicted on the game boards.

Bilingual (french / english). This game of observation develops a child’s visual acuity and concentration while providing an opportunity to learn a second language. Beautifully illustrated game boards allow children to explore prehistory, ancient Egypt, Grecian antiquity, the Middle Ages, the Far West, the pirate era, the discovery of America and, finally, a glimpse of the future.

Object of the game:
To locate illustrations in the game boards and collect as many cards as possible

Box contains:
4 game boards double sided
50 cards
Game rules

Street Drug Rummy is intended to familiarize players with the common names and major classifications of illegal and abused drugs which are all too readily available on the streets today.

The object of the game is to group the cards with General Classification, Specific Drug Families, Way Administered or Sudden Death. Players can challenge another player on classifications, families, or sudden death combinations. The drug chart (last page) is used to judge the validity of the challenge.

Components:
54 cards

The players will be able to organize keyboard musical-note representations into appropriate chord formations and state the name of the chord sequence correctly.

If the player has three or four cards forming a chord, the chord sequence is placed on the table. The player must then tell the other players the name of the chord. If correct, this player's turn continues by selecting another card as in step 2. If the player is incorrect, another player may "steal" the chord by stating the chord name correctly.
The winner is the player with the most chord formations.

Components:
46 cards

Players will be able to analyze physical quantities into their fundamental units of measurement.

The object of Striking a Balance is to form balanced equations of physical units that appear in many physics formulas. Equations are formed with cards in various combinations, each card bearing a physical quantity which is broken down into its fundamental units. The winner of a round is the first person to "go out" as in Rummy, which means that the player can use all the cards in his/her hand to form complete equations. Points may be accumulated at the end of each round and the grand wazoo is the player who reaches 100 points first.

Components:
48 cards

The players will be able to identify the personal pronoun and verb tense of irregular Spanish verbs. This edition of the game includes only the present, imperfect, preterite, future and conditional tenses.

Gameplay is similar to poker. Combinations are with Spanish persons, tenses and verbs.

Components:
For twenty irregular verbs, there are a possible 500 cards.

The players will be able to correctly complete subtraction sentences.

The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all of his/her cards. To do this, the players must use their cards to make subtraction sentences.
Player places in his turn either a number card, a minus card, an equals card, or a wild card with the face up card to create a subtraction sentence. A wild card can stand for any card the player wants.

Components:
75 cards

The players will be able to increase their vocabulary.

The object of the game is to form sets of two or three cards which are synonyms. 
The first player to go out (have no more cards in his hand) wins. If a time limit is set instead, the winner is the player with the most cards on the table at the end of the predetermined time period.

Components:
250 cards

name.value: The Game of Hickory, Dickory, Dock

item.description:
Information from gamearchives.org:

Each player selects a piece and begins the game either on the "Start Here" space or the "Or Here" space. Players take turns spinning the indicator and moving up as many places as the indicator shows. Players play in turn trying to reach the UPPER SPACE first. A player must reach the UPPER SPACE by exact count in order to win. "When the clock strikes 1" that is to say, when a player spins a 1, instead of moving forward one space his piece is immediately dropped to one of the spaces marked "Start Here" and the players piece is obliged to climb again. The only time a 1 does not cause a piece to return to the start space is if the piece is 1 spot away from winning and a 1 would be required to win the game. Then the 1 spin does indeed win the game.

From Gamearchive.org.

The popular story of "Robinson Crusoe" forms the basis for this game for children. In the pack of cards, with which the game is played are several cards which have exact duplicates, but there is only one card each for Robinson Crusoe, Friday and Rescue Ship. The cards are dealt out one at a time and if the player has two cards that are the same kind, that is 2 Goats, Turtles, Cannibals etc. the player pairs them up and they are thrown out of the game. Then the start player begins by drawing randomly from the player to his left 1 card. If he pairs a card the pair is removed, Then the next player draws a card. Play continues this way until one player successfully gets the 3 cards CRUSOE,FRIDAY, and RESCUE in his hand whereby winning the game.

In this game there is a board on which are illustrated the castle at Zenda and the palace at Streslau and numerous playing tracks representing the roads between them. There are 3 dice, 4 large pieces and 8 small green pieces who are soldiers. The large red piece represents the king who was the Prizoner of Zenda, 2 large yellow pieces represent Rudolph and Colonel Sapt and the large Green piece represents Black Michael. To win the Zenda player has to capture green pieces with his yellow pieces to open a hole in the green line through which his red piece may slip to Streslau and thus win the game. The Streslau player should try and stop all paths leading to his city by blockade at critical points.

The game centers on a 3-D tree with a plastic trunk and cardboard leaves. Each player gets 3 monkeys in their color (there are 12 monkeys total plus one black chimpanzee figure). Players roll dice to have their monkeys climb the tree via holes in the trunk. If a double is thrown, the player must place the chimpanzee figure a number of holes. Any monkeys the chimpanzee passes must return to the bottom of the tree and start over. The first player to get three monkeys to the top of the tree wins.

BOMP! Reach the center of the ring and Bomp out your opponents, with grace and precision! 
Only one will survive, or maybe two, or maybe all of your three warriors, if you Bomp really well!

Bomp is a fast paced and interactive fingertip game, for 1,2,3,4 players (solo game is possible and useful to train your fingers) up to 8 players with the expansions you can choose with other 4 teams you like.

Realized with big and coloured 25 mm Spielmaterial wooden discs, the game was presented at Ideag 2010.

For any info-order feel free to contact the author
anporaz@libero.it
Along the lines of Scrutineyes and / or Where's Waldo. Search and find different animals on a colorful game board.
A checkers varient with a spinner determining possible moves. The game board also dictates special or extra possible moves.
A track movement sailing adventure game. Basically roll and move with an unusual looking game board that has the instructions printed on it.

Typical roll and move game on a very boring looking game board that is somewhat hard on the eyes.

Contents include: 32 Playing Cards, 4 Markers, 10 Fire Safety Tips Cards, 10 Chief's Orders & 1 Die.

Game about the short lived Saturday morning TV series. There was a band called the Guys Next Door (1 album released) and the TV show centered around a series of sketch comedy skits featuring the band. Basically, it was a failed attempt at capitalizing on the New Kids on the Block mania.

The game is a typical teen girl fantasy game about boys.

Contents include: 20 Personal Color Photos, Set of Dream Girl Fantasy Cards, Dream Girl Spinner, 4 Pawns & Photo Gameboard with BONUS autographed photo of Guys on the back.

name.value: Oh Magoo, You've Done it Again

item.description:
A roll and move game with colorful 3D board elements. Instructions are printed on the board.

Contents include: 5 Player Pieces, 17 Playing Cards, 8 Card Buildings and Die.

A traditional game from Liberia. This game is played by Queah tribe. Game plays on a 5x5 checkered board. Each player has 10 piece in his own color. Game start with an initial start positon with 8 game piece in two different color on board.Pieces moves diagonally as checkers.

On each turn, each player may:
Move one stone to a diagonal adjacent empty cell.
Or, jump (diagonally) over an enemy stone landing on the immediate empty cell. The jumped stone is captured and the other player must place a piece to an empty cell of the board with same color with used cells of board. (if there are in staock). The players only use the squares of the same color).

The aim of this game is capturing all ennemy stones.

This game is played on an empty 5x5 square board. There are 24 white and 24 black game pieces. The game has two phase. Drop phase and move phase according to rules.The players try to capture, their opponent pieces.
DROP PHASE - In his turn, each player must place a game piace in his/her own color on an empty cell, except the central cell which should be empty until this first phase is over.
When 24 stones are dropped, the game continues with the move phase.

MOVE PHASE - At each turn, each player must do one of the following actions:
Move a friendly stone to an orthogonally adjacent empty cell.
There are custodian captures, i.e., every enemy stone between the moved stone and another friendly stone (over the same line) switches color.
After a move with results in a capture, the moved stone may optionally move again into its initial cell (which may result in more custodian captures).
If a player cannot move any stone, he should pick one of his/her game piece from any cell and place it on an empty cell, executing the eventual custodian captures.
The player who has only four stones or less, loses the game.

This game is played on a 5x5 board. Game starts with a setup position.
Each player moves one of his stones orthogonally respecting the following restriction:
The moved Black stone must create at least one adjacent area of 3 or 5 empty cells.
The moved White stone must create at least one adjacent area of 2 or 4 empty cells.
The aim of this game is trapping the opponent pieces.
The first player unable to make a move, loses.

This game is played on a 5x5 board. Game starts with an initial setup position. On each turn, each player must move two friendly stones to adjacent (diagonal or orthogonal) empty cells, both in the same direction. Stones cannot move into the restricted points on game board.

The player that first moves 5 stones to the last row wins the game.

This game is played on an empty 1row x n coloumn board with m stones on each side. At each turn, each player must do one of the following actions. Move a stone forward (i.e., left to one player, right to the other) or jump over one enemy stone, landing on the immediate empty cell.
The player who makes the last move, wins the game.

link.value: Winning Ways for Your Mathematical Plays

item.description:
This game is played on a 5x5 square board. Players start to game with a initial setup position. Each player has 7 game piece in his/her own color.
On each turn, each player must do one of the following things:
Capture a stone on a (orthogonal or diagonal) forward direction by jumping over it and landing on the immediate empty cell. Captures are multiple and mandatory.
Drop a captured friendly stone on any empty cell.
Move a stone on a (orthogonal or diagonal) forward direction to an empty cell.
The player that moves his all game pieces to the opponent's setup position wins the game.

This game was presented at 100 Strategic Games for Pen and Paper by Walter Joris. The game is played on a 4x4 board. Each player has 4 game piece in his/her own color.
At the begining of the game each player alternately, place eight friendly stones each.
During just four turns, each player shifts one row left/right, one column up/down or one of the two main diagonals, just by one cell. 
Every stone pushed out the board is removed from play.
After those four turns (i.e., eight shifts), The player with more stones on board wins the game (or a draw if equal).

item.description:
This game is played on a 3x4 rectangular board. Each player has 5 pieces in his/her own color.
At the begining of the game each player alternately place a stone into an empty cell exept one restricted cell.
After all cells occupied, On each turn, each player must do one of the following actions:
Capture an adjacent stone on an orthogonal direction by jumping over it and landing on the immediate empty cell. Captures are multiple and mandatory or move a piece on an orthogonal direction to an empty cell.
The player that captures all enemy stones, or has his last stone on the restricted cell wins the game.

This is a traditional game played on a 5x6 rectangular board. Each player has 12 game piece in his own color. 
At the beginin in each turn, each player places a stone from the reserve to any empty space on the board which is not adjacent (orthogonal) to a friendly stone. If a player cannot drop more stones, he must pass. This continues until all stones are placed on the board, or no more stones can be placed.
After that,in each turn, each player moves a stone to an empty adjacent (orthogonal) cell. If he is able to make 3 in a rows (not more or less) he may capture one enemy stone. It's not clear that diagonal 3 in-a-row is allowed
The player who capture all of his opponents stones wins the game

Chicken Roundabout is a board game inspired by the 'Chicken Roundabout' in in Ditchingham, near Bungay (Suffolk, UK) a roundabout (traffic circle) famous for the chickens which can always be seen there.

The game is basically an enhanced version of Pachisi/Ludo, with the addition of 'tokens' required to get the chickens home. In this version, opponents' chickens can not be sent back to the start by overtaking them.

The game was previously marketed as 'Us Chickens'. The new version differs by having local businesses featured on the spaces on the board.

From the publisher:
Dance along to Hannah Montana's awesome songs! This cool Twister Moves game allows you to listen to her music and move as the DJ tells you to! Put the CD in your machine, set out the mats and away you go! Listen carefully to the instructions and follow the fun moves! If you're the only one to get the moves right, you win! Practice on your own and then compete against friends! A wonderful way to encourage active play! Great for any Hannah Montana fan!

name.value: Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game

item.description:
From Wizards of the Coast website:

A cooperative game of adventure for 1-5 players set in the world of Dungeons & Dragons.

A heavy shadow falls across the land, cast by a dark spire that belches smoke and oozes fiery lava. A cave mouth leads to a maze of tunnels and chambers, and deep within this monster-infested labyrinth lurks the most terrifying creature of all: a red dragon!

Designed for 1-5 players, this boardgame features multiple scenarios, challenging quests, and cooperative game play.

Each player selects a hero; a rogue, thief, warrior, cleric, or wizard. On their turn, each player can explore further into the dungeon (turn over new tiles), move through the already explored parts of the dungeon, and fight monsters. When a new dungeon tile is revealed, there is typically an encounter of some sort, and new monsters to fight are added. Slain monsters reward the players with treasure, and experience points, allowing them to level up and increase their skills during play. Players must cooperate to stay alive, slay the monsters, and achieve the goal of their quest. Each scenario has a different goal - from retrieving a relic, to slaying a vampire lord.

item.description:
From the publisher:
Manufacturer's Description
BrainBox Manchester United is a game for the whole family. The game is ingeniously simple. A player has ten seconds to study a card that shows players past and present in action and is then asked a question about the card, chosen by the roll of a die. If the card is answered correctly the card is kept, if not it is returned to the box. The most cards held after ten minutes decides the winner. Cards are real photos of players, with extra information like how many caps the player has, the year of their International debut and what shirt number they wear. Hard core fans can put their knowledge to the test--especially if their powers of observation let them down. The game is presented in a smart cube box and is a perfect gift for Man U fans who already have everything.

From the publisher:
 The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the BrainBox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to player one to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the BrainBox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 or more players, ages 8+. Contains 54 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight sided die. Have fun!

Box Contains

 54 picture/question cards
 1 rules card
 1 sand timer
 1 eight-sided die

From the publisher:
What can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try and memorize as many pictures and words as you can. After ten seconds, pass the card to another player who asks a quick-fire question. Seems easy - cards include the following clubs - Arsenal, Aston Villa, Barnsley, Birmingham City, Blackburn Rovers, Blackpool, Bolton Wanderers, Bradford City, Brentford, Brighton & Hove Albion, Bristol City, Bristol Rovers, Burnley, Cardiff City, Carlisle United, Charlton Athletic, Chelsea, Chesterfield, Colchester United, Coventry City, Crystal Palace, Derby County, Doncaster Rovers, Everton, Fulham, Gillingham, Grimsby Town, Huddersfield Town, Hull City, Ipswich Town, Leeds United, Leicester City, Leyton Orient, Liverpool, Luton Town, Manchester City, Manchester United, Middlesbrough, Millwall, Newcastle United, Northampton Town, Norwich City, Nottingham Forest, Notts County, Oldham Athletic, Peterborough, Plymouth Argyle, Portsmouth, Port Vale, Preston North End, Queens Park Rangers, Reading, Scunthorpe, Sheffield United, Sheffield Wednesday, Southampton, Southend United, Stoke City, Sunderland, Swansea City, Swindon Town, Tottenham Hotspur, Tranmere Rovers, Walsall, Watford, West Bromwich Albion, West Ham United, Wigan Athletic, Wolverhampton Wanderers, Wycombe Wanderers, Yeovil

BrainBox Football Kids GamesPlayers will have 10 seconds to study a card before being asked a question from the back, chosen by the roll of the die. If the question is answered correctly the card is kept, if not it is returned to the box. The player with the most cards after 10 minutes wins the game!BrainBox Football Kids Games is a brilliant memory recall game that lasts just 10 minutes with rounds of ten seconds. Club history, famous players, fun facts and more! Features 71 football clubs from the Premiership, Championship and Leagues 1 and 2.

From the publisher:
What can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try and memorise as many pictures and words as you can. After ten seconds, pass the card to another player who asks a quick-fire question.

History How many things can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try to memorise as many of the pictures and words appearing on the beautifully-illustrated cards. After ten seconds, turn the card over, roll the die and answer a quick-fire question to win the card. The player with the most cards after 10 minutes wins. A fun way to learn history, from Stonehenge to the Channel Tunnel. Age 8 and above.

Each player represents the leadership of a 17th century Scottish clan looking to expand its territory and its wealth. The success of your clan depends on your ability to make the correct decision at the opportune time, be it by establishing a new pasture for your livestock, growing grain for the production of whisky, selling your goods on the various markets, or investing in the cultivation of special places such as lochs and castles.

Glen More offers a unique turn mechanism. Players take territory tiles from a rondel. Picking a tile has not only influence on the actions you get by the surrounding tiles in your territory, it also determines when you'll have your next turn (and how many turns you will have in the game). But having a lot of turns is not always the best strategy for a successful chieftain.

Glen More is 6 in the Alea medium box series, and is rated a 4 on the alea complexity level.

If any answers are incorrect, the card has to be put back in the Brainbox. See how many cards you have after five or ten minutes.

When the timer runs out the card is passed to player 2 and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Kings and Queens How many things can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try to memorise as many of the pictures and words appearing on the beautifully-illustrated cards. After ten seconds, turn the card over, roll the die and answer a quick-fire question to win the card. The player with the most cards after 10 minutes wins. A fun way to learn about our kings and queens of the realm. Age 8 and above.

Did you know that Vincent van Gogh painted over 900 paintings in his lifetime? And can you name the artist of Britain’s greatest painting? Developed in conjunction with London’s National Gallery, BrainBox Art is full of interesting facts and amazing images of some of the best paintings in the world in stunning high quality on 56 beautifully-illustrated cards.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game. Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material and designed in the UK, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

Players 1 or more,
Ages 8 to 88,
Contains 56 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight-sided die,

From the publisher:
 The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the BrainBox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to player one to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the BrainBox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 or more players, ages 8+. Contains 54 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight sided die. Have fun!

Includes all 44 Presidents from Washigton to Lincoln, JFK to Obama. Can we do this...Yes we can!

Loups gris en Atlantique (Grey wolves in Atlantic) is a single player game which simulates German patrols of a U-boot during WWII.

The player is a U-boot commander and his mission is to sink a maximum of allies boats during the beginning of 1941.
He has choice between 4 types of submarines (VII, IX.B, IX.C, IX.D2) with their own specificities and he can personnalize his character and crew with points.

Rules are easy and, like many solitaire games, needs a lot of dice rolls.

item.description:
Wyx is a 2 to 4 player game where each player control an ant queen on a 8 by 8 squares board.
After each move the queen lay an ant egg, althoug on some square she may lay more than one.
The moves are done by chosing from 4 columns of dominos, the top of each column being visble. Each dominos have a vertical and horizontal values indicating the move the queen will have to execute.

The aim of the game is to be the first player to lay out its 16 eggs.

item.description:
The Easter Bunny Game is a pickup and delivery game in which players of all ages move their bunnies around the board, collecting Easter eggs, and delivering them to homes in time for Easter.

The game is played with chocolate mini-eggs; approximately 24 in four colours are required each game.

If I get the balance right, older kids and adults will enjoy the challenge of planning efficient routes and beating the opponents to the more lucrative destinations, while younger kids will still enjoy scoffing the eggs :)

Ingredients:
12 cards
Board
4 counters
24 miniature chocolate eggs... you'll need a new supply for each game!

Notice: I have removed the old rules and files due to there being a completely new version in the works, and the previous versions had too many "bugs".

A game full of less brains and more shooting. Create your character, grab some items, and destroy your buddies. Build your play area however you want, using as many or as few obstacles and pickups as desired!

Gameplay consists of drawing weapon and equipment cards as well as special cards to help break the rules. From Death Matches to trying to be the Last Man Standing, there are several match types to suit different styles of play.

Move around the play area by rolling dice and measuring out the distance. It's like a single man skirmish with you trying to be the winning player as you complete the terms of victory for various match types.

Get ready for the battle of the ages when you go head to head in a series of dinosaur duels!

Is your Stegosaurus strong enough to defeat your opponent's Apatosaurus?

Let the fun and the dino duels begin!

The Dino Duel Card Game is one dino-mite game to play! Players lay down their cards in a duel. On the top of the cards is located the point value. If your Stegosaurus card contains more points than your opponent's T-Rex card, then you win that set of cards. The cards feature the Tyrannosaurus Rex, Apatosaurus, Stegosaurus, and wild cards. Any number of combinations can create different outcomes. The player with the most sets wins!

Contains 48 cards (measuring 4 1/2" x 3") and instructions. No reading required to play.

item.description: Flick Pool is a dexterity game distributed in Whataburger kids meals. It consists of round tiles and triangular "pockets". Players take turns flicking the Cue Ball into other balls to try to get them in the pockets. It's just like pool, but smaller and flatter.

As players roll the die, they make their way around a colorful racetrack. When they land on different colored spaces, players choose cards that ask them to figure out parts of speech, noun plurals, verb tenses, blends, homophones, definitions, idioms, context clues, anagrams and more. As players correctly answer questions, they power ahead on the track. Teachers can choose how many laps to complete to adapt to time constraints. Covers the following aspects of Bloom's Taxonomy: Knowledge, Comprehension, Application, Analysis

* Compact size saves space on the shelf and in the classroom
 * High-interest graphics and content
 * Short passages allow time for full comprehension and the chance to read a variety of topics
 * Winning is based on knowledge and skills, not random factors
 * Games address important content, not trivia
 * Directions are easy to understand, so as not to restrict learning opportunities
 * Players never lose points for wrong answers

Gauntlet - From the Klix Pocket Travel Games from Tiger Electronics.

The board folds out, the magnetic pieces (which function as both player pieces and tokens for the potion track) are stored in a built-in compartment and the dice are self-contained in a see-through compartment. The dice are 'rolled' by pushing and releasing the 'dice snapper'.

The board itself is broken into four sections: "Room 1", "Room 2", "Room 1-3 Treasure Room" and "Room 4". The players take turns moving through the rooms in order, landing on one of four kinds of space: a blank space, a space with food on it (which adds to the players food/HP), a space with a ghost on it (which subtracts from the same), and a space with a bomb (which advances the players 'potion track' by one). The final space on the Room 4 board contains the 'Sacred Orb'.

item.description:
The Crow and the Pitcher is a trick-taking game based on the Aesop fable of the same name. Players must play off one another in order to gain points, but the highest suited card is not always the one that takes the trick, so one must be as clever as the Crow in Aesop's fable to score points and not perish from thirst.

The deck consists of three colored suits of stone cards (numbered 2-10) and one set of black "thirst" cards (also numbered 2-10); a separate deck of pitcher cards has values from 6 to 13, with some duplicates, and one pitcher is revealed each trick. One player leads the first trick with a stone card, and other players must follow suit, if possible. If a player cannot follow suit, she can play a thirst card instead, and from the next round thirst cards can lead the trick. Whoever wins a trick leads the next trick, so winning tricks helps you dictate play.

If the sum of the colored cards is less than the pitcher value, then the lowest card matching the lead wins; this player gets all cards played (positive points for colors, negative for thirst) and the Pitcher card (worth -5 points). If the sum of the colored cards is equal to or greater than the pitcher value, then the highest card matching the lead wins, and this player gets all cards played (again, positive points for colors, negative for thirst). In all cases, cards valued higher than the trick's pitcher card do not count toward determining whether the pitcher is full.

If the trick is led by a thirst card, the highest thirst card wins, and that player takes all thirst cards played – so make sure you hold onto your low value thirst cards to avoid winning a thirst-led trick!

After three rounds, the player with the high score wins.

item.description:
A tale of teamwork and betrayal!

The mole ogre howled out as it collapsed into a bloody pile of rent flesh and broken bone. The aging knight bent over, panting heavily, and gave his dwarven peer an approving nod. It had taken great effort between them both to slay the beast, and they had each taken their share of wounds. But in the end their cooperation had paid off and they both knew it. And then their eyes found the treasure chest sitting in the corner of the room.

They looked at each other. They looked back at the treasure... and then the real fight began.

The game where YOU are the final boss!

Dungeon Run is an exciting dash through a dungeon packed with monsters and traps. Each player controls a unique hero capable of great feats, and whose powers and abilities are upgradable and customizable throughout the game. Players can work together to overcome the perils of the dungeon, or they can betray and sabotage each other as they see fit. Because in the final room of the dungeon lurks a powerful boss with the ultimate treasure - a treasure that turns its owner into the most powerful warrior they can become! Slay the boss, steal the treasure, and then run for your life as your friends try to cut you down. In Dungeon Run only one hero can escape with the fabled Summoning Stone. Don't crawl - run!

Dungeon Run features a randomly assembled dungeon that changes each time you play, as do the monsters you face and the treasures you find. Eight different heroes each with unique options for customization further add to a wealth of game play options. Choose the vicious Tundra Orc and bash your way through everything that stands in your path. Play as the cunning Grounder Wizard and use your magic to cheat the laws of nature. Select the Guild Dwarf adventurer and lay traps to ensnare your friends. There are many paths to victory in Dungeon Run. Win by working with your friends or against them - just win!

item.description:
One of the "Easyplay Kids" series. This one is a simple dice-roller.

Each player has a set of five 6-sided dice showing one of five different monsters and a rocket. One monster is revealed at random from a deck of five cards and players simultaneously roll their dice (one at a time). The round ends when one player has four dice matching the monster on the card and the fifth die does not show the rocket.

The losers pay the winner in "Mars Maggot" tokens (to feed the monster). If they can't afford to pay then they must discard a "Rocket" token. The first player to lose all their rocket tokens loses the game; the Player with the most "Mars Maggot´s" win.

item.description:
In Souvlaki Wars, players are owners of Greek restaurants serving traditional greek fast food like "souvlaki" and "gyros". They try to attract new customers, making sure they can serve them in time, increasing their fortune and fame at the same time.

Of course, this is easier said than done as many things can go wrong while trying to serve a customer: People change their minds, orders go wrong and restaurant owners try to sabotage each other.

Can you become the most successful Greek restaurant owner?

Souvlaki Wars is a light family card game for 2-4 players. Players draft new customers and try to serve them with food cards they draw at the beginning of each turn. This way they earn the money and the reputation each customer represents. However, before they have a chance to do so, cards with "Unforeseen Events" are played by every player, affecting the game in many different ways like altering the order in lines, adding more customers, decreasing the opponent's reputation etc. And of course, each player has to take into consideration that the customers are served on a first-come basis. If someone's order can't be fulfilled, everyone behind him will have to wait another turn...

The first player to reach a certain level of money and reputation is declared the winner.

The game is going to be published by the Greek company "Kaissa Chess & Games" during 2011. It is going to be bilingual, having text both in Greek and English. Its international debut will be at the 2011 Spiel Essen fair.

- Winner of BGG's Greek Guild's 1st Game Design Contest in the category: "Best Game"

name.value: Battle with the Swedes for Charles Bridge

item.description:
From the rules: "In the course of the cruel Thirty Years' War, the people inhabiting the Czech Lands were subjected to many invasions by Swedish mercenaries who looted burghers' houses, aristocratic palaces, churches, libraries and monasteries. Regardless of whether they were led by Generals Baner, Torstenson or Wrangel, the Swedes always wanted to take away as much as they could . . . On the night of July 25, 1648, the Swedish cavalry tried to conquer the Stone Bridge (today's Charles Bridge) and penetrate the Old Town through the gate in the Old Town bridge tower . . .The people of Prague, and particularly students led by Father Jiri Plachy, quickly took up arms and rushed to help the tiny unit of the tower guards. A fierce hand-to-hand fight ensued, with the fighters on both sides hiding behind the the statues on the bridge. The battle took the toll of many dead and wounded on both sides. The present game is based on this particular battle with all its snares and personal fights."

The rules are in Czech, English, German and French. The board is a simple checkerboard-type surface on medium-weight cardboard. The only other components are 28 small wooden blocks, 14 dyed red, 14 in their natural light brown coloring. There is a coin on the front of the box that is tossed at the start of the game to determine how many moves the Swedish player gets.

Each player places their 14 men on the first two rows of squares on each side of the board. The men can move one square in 12 possible directions. You eliminate your opponent's men by landing on their square and can take another turn provided you can eliminate another man with that move. All men can jump over each other. The player who has more of his men on the starting line of his rival when no one can make any more moves wins.

THIS GAME HAS BEEN DISCONTINUED.

No one knows what has led each of you to this cursed house on the hill, but here you all stand, poised to enter. The previous owner was rumored to have discovered the secrets of the house. Can you recover the fragments of his diary before it’s too late? You’ll have to work together but look out for number one while doing so.

In House of Spirits, players explore a haunted house together, room by room. Along the way they will draw cards representing weapons and other items to help them survive the various beasts within. Each player gets one action per turn, so he has to balance long term strategy against short term gains. Do you risk taking on that werewolf, hoping to claim points at the risk of precious health, or leave it for someone else to deal with?

The ultimate goal of the game is to get more points than any other player. There are numerous ways to do this depending on player strategy, as well as a dash of luck.

item.description:
From Publisher:

At the height of the industrial revolution, the Great Empire is about to take delivery of many secret crates from its colonies. These crates contain all the Emperor needs to strengthen his rule on the Empire: steel, coal, ore, and above all: gold! For security reasons, the Emperor himself has hand-picked the crew of the Nostria, one of the armored zeppelins of the imperial fleet. However, neighboring nations are organizing the resistance, and traitors are secretly boarding the airship to thwart the Emperor’s plans.

Mad Zeppelin is a fast-paced card game of sabotage, as you use your traitors to throw the most cargo off the Nostria and ruin the Emperor's plans. The player who destroys the most cargo wins, but you must assure you properly bribe the guards each turn, or your chances of sabotage may end at the point of a bayonet!

Contains: 14 Traitor cards - 100 Cargo cards of different categories - 10 Journey cards, used to mark the course of the voyage - 3 special dice - 30 tokens representing gold pieces.

item.description: This is a strategic placement game wherein each of 2 to 4 players begins with 25 regular 6-sided dice. In the center of the playing surface is a cross of dice ("the wall" - see diagram) against which dice are placed to score. Each die placed must touch two other dice, and only dice touching the same number in the wall in an uninterrupted perpendicular alignment will score. (Two players may begin with 36 dice each if available.)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Every player gets 20 cards in his/her color. Try to get a product together with four cards.
The objective of the game is to put the products on the board as favorable as possible. The player who puts his product on the middle of the board gets the most points.
The player throw two dice and put his/her two pawns on the grid of the board. Where the two pawns come together, a player can put a card of his/her product.
If there is already a card, a player can change the card (only if he/she is the owner of the product). Or can try to get the space for his own product.(players throw dice to get the space)
When a player has placed all his/her products on the board, the counting begins. The player with the most points wins the game.

There are 80 cards with questions at the front of the card. At the back of the cards there are collered lines (the ski arenas). The group or player who gets the longest line, wins the game.

The question are truth or style. If a player answers a question correctly or follows the instructions , he/she gets the card. Otherwise the card is put back in the box.

Contents:
- 80 cards
- 1 CD (just for fun)

name.value: Turn of Mind: A Game of Psychological Type

item.description:
The player will be able to identify the four elements of a psychological type and state the type represented by the phrases on the cards. The learner will be able to distinguish characteristics of the pairs of opposites represented by the phrases on each card.

The goal of the game is to form a hand comprised of one psychological type and three characteristics of one of the four areas of preference. The three characteristics must be the opposite of the one used to form the type.

Components:
52 cards

The players will be able to correctly classify contemporary and extinct chordates according to physical characteristics.

Players try to create the classification hierarchy. Players must correctly identify which Genus belongs to which Order, and which Orders belong to which Class. This can be done from memory, or by reading the Genus characteristics on the cards and matching with them with correct Order characteristics.

As players obtain cards they will be able to place them in the play area if a higher card has already been placed in the play area. (for example a Genus card can only be placed in the play area if and only if it's Order card is available.)
The game is won when a complete hierarchy is built.

Components:
126 cards
- 21 Order cards
- 35 Class cards
- 70 Genus cards

The players will be able to choose the two dimensional shapes.

The object of the game is to collect the sides needed to create the surfaces of the shapes on the green cards. For example, if you were collecting the sides of a cube you would collect and group six square side cards. You can collect the sides of more than one shape at a time if you choose! 
The game ends when a player plays all of her cards and wins or the time for the game runs out. If time runs out, add up the points on the cards in your hand. Subtract ten points for every stack of sides you successfully played in front of you during the game. The player with the LEAST number of points wins!

Components:
134 cards
- 8 green 3-d shape cards.
- 96 blue 2-d surface or side shape cards
- 30 flat red flexible building blocks

To help learn Latin names, Genus/species, and descriptions of common wildflowers found in San Diego County.

Gameplay is similar to rummy.

Components:
50 cards
